>E.g. mammals are though to have evolved from a slug like
>creature, but this creature probably didn't get an opportunity to
>multiply and flourish until it's predators had been made extinct.

Hi,

         I don't know where you got that from but mammalian ancestors 
were vertebrates long before they started to grow fur and give birth 
to live offspring...  There were slug-like things in our ancestry, 
but they are a _LOT_ further back, e.g. back at the point where 
multicellular organisms were being invented.

         Ian

In 15 minutes everybody will be in the future.
